keyword: how many calories are in a gin and tonic drink
title: How Many Calories Are in a Gin and Tonic?
meta_description: Discover how many calories are in a gin and tonic drink, including carbs, sugars, and quick tweaks for variations like diet tonic.
h1: How Many Calories Are in a Gin and Tonic?
assumptions: Standard serving: 1.5 oz (44 ml) gin, 4 oz (118 ml) tonic water, served over ice with lime wedge; no added sweeteners or garnishes.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, pour size, tonic type, and mix ratios. Alcoholic beverages' calories can differ; consult labels or apps for precision.

quick_answer.text: A standard gin and tonic drink contains about 150 calories, primarily from the tonic's sugars.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use diet tonic water instead of regular

faqs.q: How many calories are in a gin and tonic drink with diet tonic?
faqs.a: About 110 calories, as diet tonic eliminates the sugar calories.

faqs.q: Where do the calories in a gin and tonic come from?
faqs.a: Mostly from the tonic water's sugars (15 g); gin contributes alcohol calories but no carbs or fat.

faqs.q: Is a gin and tonic low-carb?
faqs.a: No, regular tonic adds 15 g carbs; opt for diet tonic for under 1 g carbs.

faqs.q: How does pour size affect calories in gin and tonic?
faqs.a: Larger gin pours add ~65 kcal per oz; more tonic adds ~10 kcal per oz.

faqs.q: What are the macros for a standard gin and tonic?
faqs.a: 150 kcal, 15 g carbs (all sugars), 0 g protein, 0 g fat.
